body_html: I'd say it's "expected" more than "intended". Dataset.batch() doesn't currently include any special-case code that observes when its input is infinite. tf.contrib.data.batch_and_drop_remainder() gives you a workaround for the case when your code requires static shapes, or you can use a manual Tensor.set_shape() on the tensors returned from Iterator.get_next().
body_text: I'd say it's "expected" more than "intended". Dataset.batch() doesn't currently include any special-case code that observes when its input is infinite. tf.contrib.data.batch_and_drop_remainder() gives you a workaround for the case when your code requires static shapes, or you can use a manual Tensor.set_shape() on the tensors returned from Iterator.get_next().
body: I'd say it's "expected" more than "intended". `Dataset.batch()` doesn't currently include any special-case code that observes when its input is infinite. `tf.contrib.data.batch_and_drop_remainder()` gives you a workaround for the case when your code requires static shapes, or you can use a manual `Tensor.set_shape()` on the tensors returned from `Iterator.get_next()`.
